meanings.definition: Of or relating to dyeing or coloring.
meanings.sent1: The tinctorial process involves adding color to fabric.
meanings.sent2: The artist used tinctorial techniques to create vibrant paintings.
meanings.sent3: The tinctorial solution accidentally dyed the artist's hands blue.
meanings.sent4: Her tinctorial skills transformed the plain cloth into a rainbow of hues.
meanings.sent5: The tinctorial effect of the dye made the fabric glow with rich colors.

meanings.sent1: Be careful with that tinctorial ink, it can stain easily.
meanings.sent2: The tinctorial properties of the substance allowed it to color the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The tinctorial spill on the carpet left a stubborn mark.
meanings.sent4: His tinctorial hands betrayed his involvement in the painting project.
meanings.sent5: The tinctorial nature of the liquid made it perfect for tie-dyeing shirts.

meanings.definition: Having the quality of imparting color.
meanings.sent1: The flowers had a tinctorial effect on the garden, brightening it up.
meanings.sent2: The tinctorial nature of the fruit juice made it a popular natural dye.
meanings.sent3: The tinctorial cupcakes were a hit at the party, adding a pop of color.
meanings.sent4: Her tinctorial personality brought life and vibrancy to the group.
meanings.sent5: The tinctorial sunset painted the sky in shades of pink and orange.
